column4: I want to connect to both a wireless and a wired network. the wireless network as an internet gateway, but the wired network does not. In fact, I want this computer to be the internet gateway on the wired network. how do I do this? in my network manager I cannot seem to simultaneously connect to two networks
try "routed", a program, routing daemon
google i
I think your network manager just sets the primary network device, which to use to go to Internet. but in fact you're connected to both (if there are no problems like with IPs or something... )
I said for it to start after services, not interfaces
I found this: http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=91370 but its 3 years old
any ideas where I can learn how to setup ics?
I think the howto you provided is just fine. If you think you can follow the steps, there shouldn't be any problem :)
routed as I suggested before was the first thing that came on my mind, it's probably old by now. As you can see, Googling is really helpful, you managed it on your own :)
it says "Reconfigure ipmasq to start after networking has been started"... is this after network interfaces are brought up or network services?
looks like I made the wrong choice then...
I hope I can just back up to that step
why? what's wrong?
it shouldn't be a problem, you can try it and then reconfigure
if it wouldn't work
now wicd says I am connected to the wired network
yet I am still talking to you
bleh... weird things... I don't like 'em
you see, you're still connected over both interfaces
I dunno, did you see it twice?
yes you are
I said "testing123" twice...
yes, you did :)
so wicd is simple setting the "default" interface, then
